bcsr_matrix_t Struct Reference

#include <bcsr_matrix.h>


Data Fields

int bm

Detailed Description

Sparse matrix in Block Compressed Sparse Row (BCSR) format.

Field Documentation

int bcsr_matrix_t::bm

Number of block rows in the matrix (actual number of rows is r*bm)

int bcsr_matrix_t::bn

Number of block columns in the matrix (actual number of columns is c*bn)

int bcsr_matrix_t::c

Number of columns in each (dense) subblock

int bcsr_matrix_t::col_oriented_p

0 if the nonzero blocks are row-oriented, 1 if column-oriented

int* bcsr_matrix_t::colind

Array of column indices of the upper left corners of the nonzero blocks of the matrix. These are the actual column indices and not the "block indices".

int bcsr_matrix_t::nnzb

Number of stored (nonzero) blocks in the matrix. If the matrix is stored in a symmetric (or skew, etc.) format, nnz only refers to the number of stored entries, not the actual number of nonzeros.

int bcsr_matrix_t::r

Number of rows in each (dense) subblock

int* bcsr_matrix_t::rowptr

Array of indices into the colind and values arrays, for each row

enum symmetric_storage_location_t bcsr_matrix_t::symmetric_storage_location

If the matrix has a kind of symmetry (or skew-symmetry): Where the actual elements of the matrix are stored: in the lower triangle or the upper triangle.

enum symmetry_type_t bcsr_matrix_t::symmetry_type

Symmetry type of the matrix.

enum value_type_t bcsr_matrix_t::value_type

Indicates the type of the entries in val: REAL means "double", COMPLEX means "double _Complex", PATTERN means the "val" array is NULL and contains no entries.

void* bcsr_matrix_t::values

Array of stored (nonzero) entries of the matrix
